net.hudup.core.evaluate

Interface Metric

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Alg, AlgRemote, java.util.EventListener, Exportable, MetricRemote, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable, SetupAlgListener
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DefineMeanMetric, GraphicMetric
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Accuracy, Accuracy, ARHR, ArrayMetric, ClassificationAccuracy, CorrelationAccuracy, DefaultMetric, ErrorRange, ExactRecallMetric, F1, HudupRecallMetric, MAE, MAE, MAERatio, MAEVector, MeanMetaMetric, MetaMetric, MetricAbstract, MetricRemoteWrapper, MetricWrapper, MetricWrapper2, MSE, MSE, NDPM, NMAE, NMSE, Precision, PredictiveAccuracy, R, R, Recall, RMSE, RMSE, RNMSE, SetupTimeMetric, Spearman, SpeedMetric, TimeMetric, TwoArrayMetric, VectorMetric

    public interface Metric
extends MetricRemote, Alg, java.io.Serializable
    In Hudup framework, there are two kinds of result:
    • Recommendation result is represented by the output of method Recommender#estimate(...) or Recommender#recommend(...), which is used for recommendation process. The recommendation result is represented by RatingVector class containing ratings.
    • Evaluation result is represented by this Metric interface which is the output of evaluation process. It is derived from recommendation result and used for qualifying algorithm. Metric is also called measure.
    In general, metric specifies the final result of algorithm evaluation. For example, MSE, abbreviation of mean squared error, measures the average squared deviation between the predictive rating (from a recommendation algorithm - recommender) and user true rating. MSE is a popular metric. The less the MSE is, the better the recommendation algorithm is.
    Followings are essential methods of metric:
    • Method MetricRemote.recalc(Object...) is the most important one expressing how to re-calculate a concrete metric.
    • Methods MetricRemote.getAccumValue() and MetricRemote.getAccumValue() return accumulative value and current value of metric. After each time metric is re-calculated by MetricRemote.recalc(Object...) method, accumulative value and current value can be changed. For example, a sample metric receives values 3, 1, 2 at the first, second, and third calculations. At the fourth calculation if MetricRemote.recalc(Object...) produces value 2, the MetricRemote.getCurrentValue() will return 2 and the MetricRemote.getAccumValue() will return 3 + 1 + 2 + 2 = 8. Methods MetricRemote.getAccumValue() and MetricRemote.getCurrentValue() can return any thing and so their returned value is represented by MetricValue interface. How to implement MetricValue is dependent on concrete application.
    The abstract class of Metric interface is {code AbstractMetric}. Three implemented classes of Metric which inherit from AbstractMetric are DefaultMetric, MetaMetric, and MetricWrapper as follows:
    • DefaultMetric class is default partial implementation of single Metric.
    • MetaMetric class is a complex Metric which contains other metrics.
    • In some situations, if metric requires complicated implementation, it is wrapped by MetricWrapper class.
    Note, metric is also algorithm because it extends Alg interface. Therefore it is registered in system register table and identified by its name. Plug-in manager presented by PluginManager interface discovers automatically all metrics via their names at the booting time.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
